newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia begins probe into Tenaga - paper.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia begins probe into Tenaga - paper.

text.p: Malaysia's Anti-Corruption Agency (ACA) has begun an investigation into alleged malpractices and abuse of power in state electric utility Tenaga Nasional Bhd, the New Sunday Times newspaper said on Sunday.
The Times quoted ACA deputy director-general Mohamed Zawawi as saying the probe would follow up allegations raised in a Tenaga internal audit report.
"The probe commenced early last week after the agency was given a copy of the report, which is being studied by the investigating team," Zawawi said.

The voluminous report, excerpts of which have been shown to Reuters and obtained by local newspapers, raised questions over Tenaga's tendering process, administrative procedures and management of the utility's subsidiaries.
The report also exposed alleged surveillance and telephone tapping of certain employees.
The New Straits Times quoted Zawawi as saying the agency would soon complete a probe into allegations surrounding a logging contract by Tenaga and detailed in the audit report.
The report was leaked to the media after a 12-15 hour blackout on August 3 in Peninsula Malaysia that embarrassed politicians and Tenaga officials.
